Finite differences formulation of the heat conduction problem¶

The full heat conduction-advection-production equation seen before can be stated in 1D as

(1)¶\[\rho(x) C_p(x) \left( \frac{\delta T}{\delta t} + v_x \frac{\delta T}{\delta x} \right) = \frac{\delta}{\delta x} \left( \alpha(x) \frac{\delta T}{\delta x} \right) + H(x)\]

We can simplify equation (1) by assuming that there is no advection of heat and that all the physical properties are constant:

(2)¶\[\rho C_p \frac{\delta T}{\delta t} = \alpha \frac{\delta^2 T}{\delta x^2} + H\]

Exercise

Discretize the equation (2). Use forward difference approximation in time (\(t\)) and central difference approximation in space (\(x\)).
